author: DarwinJS
body:
Major documentation upgrade and reorganization to try to surface the fact that the Universal Installer also supports Chocolatey ;) 

https://github.com/DarwinJS/ChocoPackages/blob/master/openssh/readme.md

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: Perhaps an implementation of the [Enable-SSHRemoting RFC](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell-RFC/blob/master/1-Draft/RFC0012-Enable-SSH-Remoting.md) can leverage this

comments.author: DarwinJS
comments.body: Sounds interesting.  I would be keen to understand what happens if openssh is installed for one of the purposes (regular or SSHRemoting) and then someone runs the installer to configure the other scenario.  Definitely, if both scenarios were managed in the same installer there would be a better chance that something sensible would happen :)

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: I would think your installer only serves to install OpenSSH (perhaps check if it's already installed).  Enable-SSHRemoting would handle additional configuration for PowerShell remoting over SSH.

comments.author: DarwinJS
comments.body: I have blogged the universal installer with some more details here: https://cloudywindows.com/post/unveiling-the-openssh-universal-automated-installer/
